pytket.backends.projectq¶

Backend for utilising the ProjectQ simulator directly from pytket

class pytket.backends.projectq.ProjectQBackend¶
empty_cache()¶

Manually empty the result cache on the backend.

get_counts(circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit, n_shots: Optional[int] = None, seed: Optional[int] = None, valid_check: bool = True, remove_from_cache: bool = True, basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo) → Dict[Tuple[int, ...], int]¶

Run the circuit on the backend and accumulate the shot results into a summary of counts. This will fail if the circuit does not match the device’s requirements. If results for the circuit are already in the backend’s cache from running process_circuits, those will be returned, regardless of the number of shots requested here.

Parameters

  • circuit (Circuit) – The circuit to run.

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) – Number of shots to generate.

  • seed (Optional[int], optional) – Seed to set for simulations. None is to be used for quantum hardware or when a seed is not needed. Defaults to None

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True.

  • remove_from_cache (bool, optional) – Remove the circuit’s results from the backend’s cache. Defaults to True.

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) – Toggle between ILO (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids) and DLO (decreasing lexicographic order) for column ordering. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

Returns

Dictionary mapping observed readouts to the number of times observed.

Return type

Dict[Tuple[int, ..],int]

get_operator_expectation_value(state_circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit, operator: openfermion.ops._qubit_operator.QubitOperator, valid_check: bool = True) → complex¶

Calculates the expectation value of the given circuit with respect to the operator using the built-in ProjectQ functionality

Parameters

  • state_circuit (Circuit) – Circuit that generates the desired state \(\left|\psi\right>\).

  • operator (QubitOperator) – Operator \(H\).

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all required predicates to run on the backend. Defaults to True

Returns

\(\left<\psi | P | \psi \right>\)

Return type

complex

get_pauli_expectation_value(state_circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit, pauli: Iterable[Tuple[int, str]], valid_check: bool = True) → complex¶

Calculates the expectation value of the given circuit using the built-in ProjectQ functionality

Parameters

  • state_circuit (Circuit) – Circuit that generates the desired state \(\left|\psi\right>\).

  • pauli (Iterable[Tuple[int,str]]) – Sparse Pauli operator \(P\) [p1, p2, p3, …] where each pi = (q, s) with qubit index q and Pauli s (“I”, “X”, “Y”, “Z”).

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all required predicates to run on the backend. Defaults to True

Returns

\(\left<\psi | P | \psi \right>\)

Return type

complex

get_shots(circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit, n_shots: Optional[int] = None, seed: Optional[int] = None, valid_check: bool = True, remove_from_cache: bool = True, basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo) → numpy.ndarray¶

Run the circuit on the backend and returns a table of the shots. This will fail if the circuit does not match the device’s requirements. If results for the circuit are already in the backend’s cache from running process_circuits, those will be returned, regardless of the number of shots requested here.

Parameters

  • circuit (Circuit) – The circuit to run.

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) – Number of shots to generate.

  • seed (Optional[int], optional) – Seed to set for simulations. None is to be used for quantum hardware or when a seed is not needed. Defaults to None

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True.

  • remove_from_cache (bool, optional) – Remove the circuit’s results from the backend’s cache. Defaults to True.

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) – Toggle between ILO (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids) and DLO (decreasing lexicographic order) for column ordering. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

Returns

Table of shot results. Each row is a single shot, with columns ordered by classical bit order (according to basis). Entries are 0 or 1 corresponding to qubit basis states.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

get_state(circuit: pytket.circuit.Circuit, valid_check: bool = True, remove_from_cache: bool = True, basis: pytket.circuit.BasisOrder = BasisOrder.ilo) → numpy.ndarray¶

Calculate the statevector for a circuit. Statevectors \([a_{00}, a_{01}, a_{10}, a_{11}]\) are little-endian, so \(a_{01}\) is the amplitude when qubit q[0] is in state \(\left|1\right>\) and qubit q[1] is in state \(\left|0\right>\). If results for the circuit are already in the backend’s cache from running process_circuits, those will be returned.

Parameters

  • circuit (Circuit) – The circuit to simulate.

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that the circuit satisfies all of the required predicates before running. Defaults to True.

  • remove_from_cache (bool, optional) – Remove the circuit’s results from the backend’s cache. Defaults to True.

  • basis (BasisOrder, optional) – Toggle between ILO-BE (increasing lexicographic order of bit ids, big-endian) and DLO-BE (decreasing lexicographic order, big-endian) for column ordering. Defaults to BasisOrder.ilo.

Returns

Full statevector in encoding given by basis.

Return type

np.ndarray

process_circuits(circuits: Iterable[pytket.circuit.Circuit], n_shots: Optional[int] = None, seed: Optional[int] = None, valid_check: bool = True)¶

Submit circuits to the backend for running. The results will be stored in the backend’s result cache to be retrieved by the corresponding get_<data> method.

Parameters

  • circuits (Iterable[Circuit]) – Circuits to process on the backend.

  • n_shots (Optional[int], optional) – Number of shots to run per circuit. None is to be used for state/unitary simulators. Defaults to None.

  • seed (Optional[int], optional) – Seed to set for simulations. None is to be used for quantum hardware or when a seed is not needed. Defaults to None

  • valid_check (bool, optional) – Explicitly check that all circuits satisfy all required predicates to run on the backend. Defaults to True

property default_compilation_pass¶

A suggested compilation pass that will guarantee the resulting circuit will be suitable to run on this backend with as few preconditions as possible.

Returns

Compilation pass guaranteeing required predicates.

Return type

BasePass

property required_predicates¶

The minimum set of predicates that a circuit must satisfy before it can be successfully run on this backend.

Returns

Required predicates.

Return type

List[Predicate]
